alert.note: Alert for Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN... NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM AND WEST CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Aylett, or near Saint Stephens Church, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saint Stephens Church around 820 PM EDT. Newtown around 845 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Enfield, Biscoe, Central Garage, Owenton, Globe, Pollards Corner, Turpin, Upshaw, Salvia, and Indian Neck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen
